meanings.sent1: I will be prestamping the envelopes before the event.
meanings.sent2: The company always prestamps the packages for efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried prestamping its paw on the paper, thinking it was a game.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to prestamp the idea in my mind, making it hard to forget.
meanings.sent5: The teacher showed us how prestamping can save time and effort in our projects.

meanings.definition: The act of stamping (something) in advance.
meanings.sent1: Prestamping is a common practice in the mailing industry.
meanings.sent2: The prestamping of the documents was completed before the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The prestamping of the passports made the travelers feel like VIPs.
meanings.sent4: The prestamping of memories in our minds can sometimes alter our perceptions.
meanings.sent5: The prestamping of the logo on the products made them look professional and polished.
